intro: Hackelia deflexa, commonly known as the pinkroot or redroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in open woodlands and rocky slopes. The plant features slender, branching stems and produces showy clusters of pink to red flowers in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Hackelia deflexa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
